alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 3:51AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna and Luzerne. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the area. Rainfall rates up to 2.5 inches per hour are expected. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in parts of the advisory area, especially the more urban locations. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches in a short amount of time are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Hazleton, Pittston, Muhlenberg, Dunmore, Old Forge, Archbald, Dickson City, Moosic, Olyphant, Edwardsville, West Hazleton, Freeland, Luzerne, Bear Creek, West Wyoming, Moscow, Conyngham and Nescopeck. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
